critique: The document expresses strong concerns about the influx of illegal aliens and illicit drugs, framing it as a national emergency. The tone is assertive and decisive, aiming to convey a sense of urgency and determination to address the issues. The language used is strong, emphasizing the threats to national security and the well-being of citizens. The document aims to elicit fear and concern about the dangers posed by these issues, as well as a sense of hope that the actions taken will lead to positive change. The document also expresses anger and disgust towards the actions of Mexico and the drug cartels. Surprise is not a primary emotion conveyed, as the document presents the issues as ongoing and well-known. Sadness is present due to the loss of life from drug overdoses. Joy is not a primary emotion.
